chargeHist.descr: Criminal Damage to Property - Domestic Abuse Repeater

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aaron F. Lor

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 11, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

9:50 AM cases 22CF921, 22CF80, 21CT379, 22CT323, 21CT324 called. Prosecuting Attorney Trenton John Piltz in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Aaron F. Lor in court with Attorney Matthew Krische. Court orders that Attorney Krische's county appointment be extended to 22CF921. 

22CF921 and 22CF80: Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas. Court receives the pleas and orders 20 days to file motions, can be extended with good cause.

Branch 2 Judicial Assistance for further scheduling.
Same as Complaint.

9:45am Cases called: 21CT323, 21CT324, 21CT379, 22CF80 & 22CF921. Defendant Aaron F. Lor in court.  Attorney Matthew Krische in court for Aaron F. Lor.  Deputy District Attorney Angela Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

22CF80 & 22CF921: Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in both felony cases and Court accepts waiver. All cases referred to Br. 2 for scheduling.
Arraignment on October 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:32 AM cases 21CT323, 21CT324, 21CT379, 22CF80, 22CF921 called. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Aaron F. Lor not in court.  Attorney Matthew Krische in court for Aaron F. Lor. State requests a warrant- So ordered. 
9:48 AM cases re called. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Aaron F. Lor in court.  Attorney Matthew Krische in court for Aaron F. Lor. 
Defense waives reading of the complaint and time limits for the preliminary hearing in 22CF921. 
Previously ordered warrants are quashed in all files. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 9-12-22 at 2:30 pm.
Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on September 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:39 AM cases 21CT323, 21CT324, 21CT379, 22CF80 called. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Aaron F. Lor in court.  Attorney Matthew Krische in court for Aaron F. Lor.
Hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on August 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:40 AM Cases called: 21CT323, 21CT324, 21CT379 & 22CF80 Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Aaron F. Lor in court.  Attorney Matthew Krische in court for Aaron F. Lor. There is not an agreement at this time.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Matthew Krische  at $100/hr.  Defendant shall reimburse Eau Claire County by making payments of $100 beginning 01/28/2022 and every 30 days thereafter.  Payment shall not exceed the full cost of representation.
Proposed Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney
Hearing on April 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.

(Cases 21CT324, 21CT379, 21CT323, 22CF80 are called at 9:46 AM) Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Aaron F. Lor appeared in court, Attorney Matthew Krische appeared in court for Aaron F. Lor. 
Defense requests to be appointed to 22CF80. So ordered. 
Pre-Trial Conference: 03/21/2022 at 2:30 PM. Hearing: 04/14/2022 at 9:30 AM.

Conditions:
No contact with K.T. or her residence. 
Visitation/exchange to be arranged through 3rd party.
Defendant allowed to retrieve belongings one time if accompanied by a law enforcement officer.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
